info.author: Nils Loehndorf
info.description:
QUASAR
======

`QUASAR <http://www.quantego.com/>`_ is a flexible, high-performance modeling system for expressing and
solving continuous state, finite-horizon stochastic-dynamic optimization problems in discrete time, where
conventional methods fail.

The QUASAR solver library provides

- an algebraic expression system for modeling stochastic-dynamic decision problems with only few lines of code.
- a solution engine that combines scenario generation, model decomposition, and mathematical optimization.
- tools and data structures to store, analyze, and visualize simulation output.


Installation
------------

Download and install the latest stable version of from `PyPI <https://pypi.python.org>`_::

    pip install quasar

The Python package includes a trial version of QUASAR out-of-the-box. For an academic trial,
or a productive license for commercial use, visit `quantego.com <http://www.quantego.com>`_.

Requirements
------------

Python 2.7 or 3.4 and Java JRE/JDK 1.7 or later.


Usage
-----

QUASAR is designed for usage with `Jupyter <http://jupyter.org/>`_. For sample notebooks, check out our
`tutorial repository <https://github.com/quantego/python-tutorial>`_.


Licensing
---------
Commercial Quantego License. See the LICENSE file for details.
